function: Display a responsive frontend interface showcasing a personal portfolio of design works with consistent styling and navigation.
static_description: The page displays a header with navigation links ('Home', 'About', 'Portfolio', 'Contact'), a hero section featuring the designer's name and tagline, followed by sections for About, Portfolio, and Contact. Background color is peach puff, and component colors (buttons, links) use indian red.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on navigation links scrolls smoothly to respective sections on the same page.
Navigation links change color slightly when hovered over for better user feedback.

resource_dependency.bioContent: Designer's biography including education, skills, and professional journey.

function: Present detailed information about the designer including background, experience, and skills in a visually engaging layout.
static_description: This section includes a left-aligned profile image referenced by 'profileImageSource', and to the right, structured text content containing the designerâ€™s bio from 'bioContent' and a vertical timeline showing work experience based on 'experienceTimelineData'.

function: Allow users to browse and explore the designer's portfolio projects through categorized thumbnails with expandable details.
static_description: A grid-based gallery displays project thumbnails sourced from 'projectThumbnails'. Each thumbnail card shows title and brief description. Clicking opens a modal/popup showing full project details according to 'projectDetailsPopupContent'.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a project thumbnail opens a modal displaying detailed project information including title, description, technologies used, and optional links to live demo or source code.

function: Provide accessible contact options such as email address, social media profiles, and a functional contact form.
static_description: Displays clearly visible contact methods including clickable email link from 'emailAddress', icons linking to social platforms defined in 'socialMediaLinks', and a simple form with fields listed under 'contactFormFields'. All interactive elements follow the indian red color scheme.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the email address opens the default mail client; clicking social icons redirects to external platform pages.
Submitting the contact form triggers validation checks and sends data via POST request to /api/contact endpoint (placeholder only since this is static).

function: Apply custom theme styles across the entire website ensuring consistency in visual identity.
static_description: All pages utilize global CSS file located at 'cssThemeFile' which defines --background-color as peach puff and --primary-color as indian red. These variables are applied throughout components like buttons, headers, and backgrounds.

function: Ensure all site content is statically served without requiring dynamic server-side processing or databases.
static_description: Each HTML page in 'htmlPages' contains fully self-contained markup referencing local assets in 'contentAssets'. No JavaScript calls made to fetch remote or dynamic data during runtime.

function: Define absence of backend services due to static nature of the website content.
static_description: No backend frameworks, servers, or APIs are implemented or initialized. Site consists purely of client-side rendered HTML/CSS/JS files.

function: Configure npm scripts to allow installation of dependencies for both frontend and backend modules simultaneously.
static_description: Root package.json includes an 'install:all' script that executes 'npm install' in both frontend and backend directories sequentially.

resource_dependency.concurrentlyDevScript: concurrently "npm run dev --prefix frontend" "npm run dev --prefix backend"

function: Enable concurrent development mode execution for frontend and backend processes using a unified command.
static_description: The root package.json defines a 'dev' script utilizing 'concurrently' to launch frontend and backend development servers in parallel using their individual 'dev' commands.

function: Prepare placeholder configuration for connecting to PostgreSQL if future dynamic features were added.
static_description: Although unused currently, environment variable placeholders matching 'dbEnvVars' are documented for potential future backend integrations.

function: Document how database connectivity would be established if backend logic were introduced later.
static_description: Connection parameters align exactly with provided credentials stored in environment variables described in 'postgresConnectionConfig'. Used as reference template for backend setup.

function: Outline how frontend could integrate with backend APIs if dynamic content became necessary.
static_description: Placeholder references to API endpoints like 'fetchApiEndpoint' exist in code comments but remain inactive. Would enable AJAX requests if activated in future versions.

function: Support rendering of formatted content if markdown-based editing were incorporated into the portfolio.
static_description: CSS stylesheets such as 'markdownPreviewStyles' are included to support clean presentation of markdown-rendered content, though currently unused.

function: Enhance user engagement through lightweight interactivity while maintaining static site performance.
static_description: Elements identified in 'interactiveElementsList' respond to standard browser events (clicks, scrolls) using vanilla JS or minimal libraries to maintain responsiveness without backend reliance.

interaction_and_states.description: Triggers modal popups for project viewing and validates form inputs before submission attempt.
Enables smooth scrolling between anchor-linked sections within the single-page application.

resource_dependency.seoMetaTags: <meta name="description" content="Personal portfolio of [Designer Name], showcasing creative design works.">

function: Improve search engine visibility by implementing semantic HTML structure and meta tags.
static_description: Each HTML document incorporates relevant SEO metadata defined in 'seoMetaTags', including descriptive titles, meta descriptions, and structured headings (<h1>, <h2>) to enhance crawlability.
